thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Treasure Island’s many musical riches
thread.title_full: Treasure Island’s many musical riches - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Aidin Vaziri
title: Treasure Island’s many musical riches
text:
Photo: Jessica Christian, The Chronicle Zhalisa Clark of San Francisco hula hoops at last year’s Treasure Island Music Festival. Zhalisa Clark of San Francisco hula hoops at last year’s Treasure...
The best thing about the way the Treasure Island Music Festival is set up is that you never have to miss an act. With two stages in close proximity and alternating set times throughout the two-day concert in the middle of the bay, all you have to do is turn your head from one direction to another to see all the great music. This year’s lineup offers plenty too, with headliners the National and Deadmau5 performing along with more than 20 other acts, including Chvrches, Run the Jewels, FKA Twigs and Father John Misty. Riding the Ferris wheel might require at least standing up. Zhalisa Clark of San Francisco hula hoops at last year’s Treasure Island Music Festival. Zhalisa Clark of San Francisco hula hoops at last year’s Treasure...
The best thing about the way the Treasure Island Music Festival is set up is that you never have to miss an act. With two stages in close proximity and alternating set times throughout the two-day concert in the middle of the bay, all you have to do is turn your head from one direction to another to see all the great music. This year’s lineup offers plenty too, with headliners the National and Deadmau5 performing along with more than 20 other acts, including Chvrches, Run the Jewels, FKA Twigs and Father John Misty. Riding the Ferris wheel might require at least standing up.
